alert.note: Alert for Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 11:19PM MDT until July 05 at 4:00AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Petroleum. * WHEN...Until 230 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings have become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1117 PM MDT, Local law enforcement reported flooding from heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winnett, Flatwillow, Petrolia Lake, Cat Creek and Tiegen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
